cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the southern Gulf, then turning north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast and accelerating inland across AL-GA into the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana to Mississippi coast (near Morgan City–Biloxi corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning Morgan City, LA to MS/AL border; storm-surge warning Intracoastal City, LA to Navarre, FL; tropical-storm warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL and portions of the Yucatán Peninsula
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Florida Panhandle, then inland across Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia, the Carolinas and the Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions with gusts 25–35 mph possible Thursday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Thursday as the remnant core passes west of the port, producing localized ponding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado threat inland across the Carolinas on 29 Oct could briefly affect ground transport links to the port
